snippet: A cross-shaped steel beam pulled from the rubble of the collapsed World Trade Center in New York days after the September 11, 2001, attacks can be displayed in the national memorial museum at the site, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday....

headline.print_headline: September 11 Museum Allowed to Display Ground Zero Cross-Shaped Beam
headline.main: September 11 Museum Allowed to Display Ground Zero Cross-Shaped Beam

lead_paragraph: A cross-shaped steel beam pulled from the rubble of the collapsed World Trade Center in New York days after the September 11, 2001, attacks can be displayed in the national memorial museum at the site, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday.
